info.title: Rocket Services
info.description:
An Orchestration Layer that takes ISL services and packages them in a more targeted way for front-end applications.
This in turn makes client integration easier and reduces the complexity and size of front-end applications.

Rocket is also customisable - allowing UI engineers to ‘remix’ the existing back-end services into something that
best suits the application they are developing.

scopes.Catalog: Modify profile preferences and activity (bookmarks, watch list)

get.description: Get the details of an account along with the profiles and entitlements under it.

patch.description:
Update the details of an account.

With the exception of the address, this supports partial updates, so you can send just the
properties you wish to update.

When the address is provided any properties which are omitted from the address will be cleared.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Updated account details.

get.description: Get the available payment methods under an account.

200.description: The list of available payment methods.

post.description: Add a new payment method to an account.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Registration details for a new payment method.

get.description: Get a payment method under an account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the payment method to get.

delete.description: Remove a payment method from an account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the payment method to remove.

get.description: Get a list of all purchases made under an account.

200.description: A list of all purchases made under the account.

post.description:
Purchase a plan or item offer.
The result of a successful transaction is a new entitlement.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Details of a plan or item purchase.

200.description: The entitlement for the purchased plan or item.

put.description:
Renew a cancelled subscription or switch subscription to a different plan.

When renewing a cancelled subscription membership, hit this endpoint with
the id of subscription to renew.

To switch plans provide the id of the current active subscription membership
of the account, and in the query specify the id of the plan to switch to.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
The identifier of the current subscription membership
associated with the account.

parameters.name: planId
parameters.description: The id of the plan to switch to if switching plans.

delete.description:
Cancel a plan subscription.

A cancelled subscription will continue to be valid until the subscription
expiry date or next renewal date.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the current active subscription membership of the account.

get.description:
Get all devices registered under this account.

Also includes information around device registration and deregistration limits.

post.description:
Register a playback device under an account.

If a device with the same id already exists a `409` conflict will be returned.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Registration details for a new playback device.

409.description: A device with the provided id already exists.

get.description: Get a registered device.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the registered device e.g. serial number.

delete.description: Deregister a playback device from an account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the registered device e.g. serial number.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for this registered device e.g. serial number.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name for the device.

post.description:
Authorize a device from a generated device authorization code.

This is the second step in the process of authorizing a device by pin code.

Firstly the device must request a generated authorization code via the
`/authorization/device/code` endpoint.

This endpoint then authorizes the device associated with the code to sign in
to a user account. Typically this endpoint will be called from a page
presented in the web app under the account section.

Once authorized, the device will then be able to sign in to that account
via the `/authorization/device` endpoint, without needing to provide the 
credentials of the user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The generated device authorization code.

get.description:
Get all entitlements under the account.

This list is returned under the call to get account information so a call here is
only required when wishing to refresh a local copy of entitlements.

Get the video files associated with an item given maximum resolution, device type
and one or more delivery types.

This endpoint accepts an Account Catalog token, however if when requesting
playback files you receive an *403 status code with error code 1* then the file
you're requesting is classification restricted. This means you should switch
to target the `/account/items/{id}/videos-guarded` endpoint, passing it an Account
Playback token. If not already obtained, this token can be requested via the
`/authorization` endpoint with an account level pin.

For convenience you may also access free / public files through this endpoint
instead of the /items/{id}/videos endpoint, when authenticated.

Returns an array of video file objects which each include a url to a video.

The first entry in the array contains what is predicted to be the best match.
The remainder of the entries, if any, may contain resolutions below what was
requests. For example if you request HD-720 the response may also contain
SD entries.

If you specify multiple delivery types, then the response array will insert
types in the order you specify them in the query. For example `stream,progressive`
would return an array with 0 or more stream files followed by 0 or more progressive files.

If no files are found a 404 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the item whose video files to load.

200.description:
The list of video files available.
The first entry containing what is predicted to be the best match.

get.description:
Get the video files associated with an item given maximum resolution, device type
and one or more delivery types.

This endpoint is identical to the `/account/items/{id}/videos` however it expects
an Account Playback token. This token, and in association this endpoint, is specifically
for use when playback files are classification restricted and require an account
level pin to access them.

Returns an array of video file objects which each include a url to a video.

The first entry in the array contains what is predicted to be the best match.
The remainder of the entries, if any, may contain resolutions below what was
requests. For example if you request HD-720 the response may also contain
SD entries.

If you specify multiple delivery types, then the response array will insert
types in the order you specify them in the query. For example `stream,progressive`
would return an array with 0 or more stream files followed by 0 or more progressive files.

If no files are found a 404 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the item whose video files to load.

200.description:
The list of video files available.
The first entry containing what is predicted to be the best match.

get.description:
Generate a new account nonce.

A nonce may be required to help sign a response from a third party
service which will be passed back to these services.

For example a Facebook single-sign-on request initiated by a client
application may first get a nonce from here to include in the request.
Facebook will then include the nonce in the auth token it issues. This
token can be passed back to our services and the nonce checked for validity.

put.description: Change the password of an account.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The new account password.

put.description: Change the pin of an account.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The new account pin.

get.description: Get the details of the active profile, including watched, bookmarked and rated items.
Get the map of bookmarked item ids (itemId => creationDate) under the active profile.

Returns the list of bookmarked items under the active profile.

**NOTE:** the `getProfileLists` service is preferred over this as it supports
batching requests for lists

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to load. Starts from page 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.
The 'date-added' sort order of the returned list, either 'asc' or 'desc'.

get.description: Get the bookmark for an item under the active profile.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The id of the item to get the bookmark for.

put.description:
Bookmark an item under the active profile.

Creates one if it doesn't exist, overwrites one if it does.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The id of the item to bookmark.

delete.description: Unbookmark an item under the active profile.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The identifier of the bookmark to delete.

get.description:
Returns a list of items which have been watched but not completed under the active
profile.

Multiple episodes under the same show may be watched or in progress, however only a
single item belonging to a particular show will be included in the returned list.

The next episode to continue watching for a particular show will be the most recent
incompletely watched episode, or the next episode following the most recently
completely watched episode. Based on the specified `show_item_type` type, either the next
episode, the season of the next episode, or the show will be included in the list.

**NOTE:** the `getProfileLists` service is preferred over this as it supports
batching requests for lists

parameters.name: show_item_type
parameters.description:
The item type to be returned for continue watching items belonging to a show.

Multiple episodes under the same show may be watched or in progress, however only a
single item belonging to a particular show will be included in the returned list.

The next episode to continue watching for a particular show will be the most recent
incompletely watched episode, or the next episode following the most recently
completely watched episode. Based on the specified `show_item_type` type, either the next
episode, the season of the next episode, or the show will be included in the list.

If `episode` is specified, then only the next episode to continue watching for a
show will be returned.

If `season` is specified, then only the season of the next episode will be returned.

If `show` is specified, then only the show of the next episode will be returned

The recommended value of this parameter should reflect the desitination the
user will be sent to when they select this item in the list. So if a user will
be sent to the show detail page then this should be `show` and you can use
the `include` parameter to get metadata about the episode or season if needed

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Include one opr more ancestor/children for items belonging to a show. Extra items
will be populated in the `listData` property of the list

If no value is specified no dependencies are included.

If `episode` is specified, then the next episode will be added for season/show
items. Has no effect if `show_item_type` is set to `episode`.

If `season` is specified, then the season of the next episode will be added for
episode/show items. Has no effect if `show_item_type` is set to `season`.

If `show` is specified, then the show of the next episode will be added for
episode/season items. Has no effect if `show_item_type` is set to `show`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to load. Starts from page 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of an item returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

get.description: Get the map of followed item ids (itemId => creationDate) under the active profile.

Returns the list of items followed under the active profile.

**NOTE:** the `getProfileLists` service is preferred over this as it supports
batching requests for lists

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to load. Starts from page 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.
The 'date-added' sort order of the returned list, either 'asc' or 'desc'.

get.description: Get metadata for the "follow" of the given item under the active profile

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The id of the item to get the followed item for.

put.description:
An item followed under the active profile.

Creates one if it doesn't exist, overwrites one if it does.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The id of the item to follow.

delete.description: Unfollow an item under the active profile.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The identifier of the followed item to delete.

get.description:
Returns the next item to play given a source item id.

For an unwatched show it returns the first episode available to the account.

For a watched show it returns the last incompletely watched episode by the profile,
or the episode that immediately follows the last completely watched episode 
or nothing.

For an episode it always returns the immediately following episode, if available to
the account, or nothing.

If the response does not contain a `next` property then no item was found.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The identifier of the source item to base the next to watch item off.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of an item returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
If no value is specified no dependencies are expanded.

If 'parent' is specified then only the direct parent will be expanded.
For example if an `Episode` then the `Season` would be included.

If 'ancestors' is specified then the full parent chain is expanded.
For example if an `Episode` then both the `Season` and `Show` would be included.

200.description: The detail of the next item to play.

get.description: Returns an array of profile lists with their first page of content resolved.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description:
A comma delimited list of item profile list identifiers.

These can be list ids e.g. `14354,65473,3234` or named lists eg `ratings,bookmarks,watched`

Or more complex sort/filter queries using pipes e.g.

`14354|max_rating=AUOFLC-E|order=asc|order_by=year-added,65473|page_size=30,3234`

_Note the id must always come first for each encoded list query_

List parameters may be provide without the `param=` prefix e.g. `14354|genre:action`

Only the following options can be present.
  - `order`
  - `order_by`
  - `max_rating`
  - `page_size`
  - `item_type`
  - `param`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of items returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

200.description: The array of item lists requested. Or empty one if requested list is not profile specific

get.description: Get the map of rated item ids (itemId => rating out of 10) under the active profile.

Returns the list of rated items under the active profile.

**NOTE:** the `getProfileLists` service is preferred over this as it supports
batching requests for lists

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to load. Starts from page 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
What to order by.

Ordering by `date-modified` equates to ordering by the last rated date.

get.description: Get the rating info for an item under the active profile.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The id of the item to get the rating info for.

put.description:
Rate an item under the active profile.

Creates one if it doesn't exist, overwrites one if it does.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The id of the item to rate.

parameters.name: rating
parameters.description: The item rating between 1 and 10 inclusive.

get.description: Get the map of watched item ids (itemId => last playhead position) under the active profile.

delete.description:
Remove the watched status of items under the active profile. Passing in
specific `itemId`s to the `item_ids` query parameter will cause only these
items to be removed. **If this list is missing all watched items will be
removed**

parameters.name: item_ids
parameters.description: List of `itemId`s to delete. Omit this parameter to delete all items

get.description:
Returns the list of watched items under the active profile.

**NOTE:** the `getProfileLists` service is preferred over this as it supports
batching requests for lists

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to load. Starts from page 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description:
Filter by whether an item has been fully watched (completed) or not.

If `undefined` then both partially and fully watched items are returned.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
What to order by.

Ordering by `date-modified` equates to ordering by the last watched date.

get.description: Get the watched status info for an item under the active profile.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The id of the item to get the watched status for.

put.description:
Record the watched playhead position of a video under the active profile.

Can be used later to resume a video from where it was last watched.

Creates one if it doesn't exist, overwrites one if it does.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The id of the item being watched.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The playhead position to record.

post.description: Create a new profile under the active account.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Profile details.

get.description: Get the summary of a profile with a specific id under the active account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the profile to return.

patch.description:
Update the summary of a profile with a specific id under the active account.

This supports partial updates so you can send just the properties you wish to update.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the profile to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Updated profile details.

delete.description:
Delete a profile with a specific id under the active account.

Note that you cannot delete the primary profile.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the profile to delete.

post.description:
Request that the email address tied to an account be verified.

This will send a verification email to the email address of the primary profile containing
a link which, once clicked, completes the verification process via the /verify-email endpoint.

Note that when an account is created this email is sent automatically so there's no need
to call this directly.

If the user doesn't click the link before it expires then this endpoint can be called
to request a new verification email. In the future it may also be used if we add support
for changing an account email address.

Request one or more `Account` level authorization tokens each with a chosen scope.

Tokens are used to access restricted service endpoints. These restricted endpoints
will require a specific token type (e.g Account) with a specific scope (e.g. Catalog)
before access is granted.

For convenience, where a Profile level token with the same scope exists it will also be returned.
This removes the need to prompt a user for a password on login followed directly with a
pin prompt for a profile token of the same scope.

Where an Account level pin is supported, some tokens may be returned from this endpoint
by providing this pin instead of a password. For example the `Playback` scoped Account
token is one such type.

Any token which is returnable with an Account pin will also be returnable with the
Account password. On the inverse, not all scoped tokens that are returnable via password
will be returnable via the pin. For example when you log in you receive an Account Catalog
token. This is not obtainable from an Account pin, only password.

If both a pin and password are supplied only the password will be used.

If neither a pin or password are supplied an http 400 error will be returned.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The account credentials with requested token scope.

delete.description:
When a user signs out of an application we need to clear some
basic cookies we assigned them during token authorization.

post.description:
Get Catalog tokens for an account using a device authorization code.
Where a Profile level token of Catalog scope exists it will also be returned.

This is the final step in the process of authorizing a device by pin code.

Firstly the device must request a generated authorization code via the
`/authorization/device/code` endpoint.

The code is subsequently used to authorize the device to sign in to a given
account via the `/account/devices/authorization` endpoint. Typically this
will be from a page presented in the web app under the account section.

Once authorized, this endpoint will allow the device to sign in without
needing to provide the credentials of the user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The device id e.g. serial number and authorization code.

post.description:
Get a generated device authorization code.

This is the first step in the process of authorizing a device by pin code.
The device will make a request to this endpoint providing a unique identifier
for the device such as a serial number. This endpoint will then return a
generated code which is tied to the given device.

The code may subsequently be used to authorize the device to sign in to an
account via the `/account/devices/authorization` endpoint. Typically this
will be from a page presented in the web app under the account section.

Once authorized, the device will then be able to sign in to that account
via the `/authorization/device` endpoint, without needing to provide the 
credentials of the user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Details of the device being authorized.

post.description:
Request one or more `Profile` level authorization tokens each with a chosen scope.

Tokens are used to access restricted service endpoints. These restriced endpoints
will require a specific token type (e.g Profile) with a specific scope (e.g. Catalog)
before access is granted.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The profile id and optional pin with required token scope.

post.description: Refresh an account or profile level authorization token which is marked as refreshable.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The token to refresh.

post.description: Exchange a third party single-sign-on token for our own authorization tokens.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A single-sign-on request.

401.description:
Unauthorized.

Error codes:
  - 6000: Unknown or default error code.
  - 6001: An account with the same email already exists but it's not linked to this social identity.
  - 6002: The social provider token provided is invalid.
  - 6003: The account is already linked to a different account with the same provider.
  - 6004: The user data returned from the social provider is missing the email address.

get.description:
Get the global configuration for an application. Should be called during app statup.

This includes things like device and playback rules, classifications,
sitemap and subscriptions.

You have the option to select specific configuration objects using the 'include'
parameter, or if unspecified, getting all configuration.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
A comma delimited list of config objects to return.
If none specified then all configuration is returned.

get.description: Returns the details of an item with the specified id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
The identifier of the item to load.

The custom identifier of an item can be used here if the `use_custom_id` parameter is true.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of items returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
If no value is specified no dependencies are expanded.

If 'children' is specified then the list of any direct children will be expanded. For example
seasons of a show or episodes of a season.

If 'all' is specified then the parent chain will be expanded along with any child list at each level.
For example if an episode is specified then its season will be expanded and that season's episode list.
The season will have its show expanded and the show will have its season list expanded.

The 'all' options is useful when you deep link into a show/season/episode for the first time as
it provides full context for navigating around the show page. Subsequent navigation around
children of the show should only need to request expand of children.

If 'ancestors' is specified then only the parent chain is included.

If 'parent' is specified then only the direct parent is included.

If an expand is specified which is not relevant to the item type, it will be ignored.

parameters.name: select_season
parameters.description:
Given a provided show id, it can be useful to get the details of a child season. This option
provides a means to return the `first` or `latest` season of a show given the show id.

The `expand` parameter also works here so for example you could land on a show page and request the
latest season along with `expand=all`. This would then return the detail of the latest season with
its list of child episode summaries, and also expand the detail of the show with its list of seasons summaries.

Note the `id` parameter must be a show id for this parameter to work correctly.

parameters.name: use_custom_id
parameters.description: Set to true when passing a custom Id as the `id` path parameter.

get.description:
Returns the List of child summary items under an item.

If the item is a Season then the children will be episodes and ordered by episode number.

If the item is a Show then the children will be Seasons and ordered by season number.

Returns 404 if no children found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the item whose children to load.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to load. Starts from page 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of items returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

The sort order of the returned list, either 'asc' or 'desc'.
If a list of Seasons the list is ordered by season number.
If a list of Episodes the list is ordered by episode number.

get.description:
Returns the list of recommended similar items.
The similarity of two items is determined by the similarity of their corresponding fields, which are set in 'Recommendations' section of ISL configuration file.
That configuration specifies some aspects of output of this list:
Each configured field has a weigth, which indicates how much the equality of two items' values makes them more or less similar (the bigger the weigth is - the more similar items with equal values are).
Additionally, 'UseCosine' configuration option determines how fast similarity of multi-value fields grows.

This list is not determined by assets' relations and is used by rows D5, D6, D7 "Related" to load more assets.

Note for now, due to the size of the list being unknown, only a single page will be returned.
However, the count of returned items will not exceed the limit, which is set in configuration 'NumberOfRecommendation' field.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the item to based related items off.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to load. Starts from page 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of items returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

get.description:
Get the free / public video files associated with an item given maximum resolution,
device type and one or more delivery types.

Returns an array of video file objects which each include a url to a video.

The first entry in the array contains what is predicted to be the best match.
The remainder of the entries, if any, may contain resolutions below what was
requests. For example if you request HD-720 the response may also contain
SD entries.

If you specify multiple delivery types, then the response array will insert
types in the order you specify them in the query. For example `stream,progressive`
would return an array with 0 or more stream files followed by 0 or more progressive files.

If no files are found a 404 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the item whose video files to load.

200.description:
The list of video files available.
The first entry containing what is predicted to be the best match.

get.description:
Identical to GET /account/profile/items/{itemId}/next route but for users
that are not logged in i.e. this endpoint does not require authorisation

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The identifier of the source item to base the next to watch item off.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of an item returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
If no value is specified no dependencies are expanded.

If 'parent' is specified then only the direct parent will be expanded.
For example if an `Episode` then the `Season` would be included.

If 'ancestors' is specified then the full parent chain is expanded.
For example if an `Episode` then both the `Season` and `Show` would be included.

200.description: The detail of the next item to play.

get.description: Returns an array of item lists with their first page of content resolved.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description:
A comma delimited list of item list identifiers.

These can be list ids e.g. `14354,65473,3234`

Or more complex sort/filter queries using pipes e.g.

`14354|max_rating=AUOFLC-E|order=asc|order_by=year-added,65473|page_size=30,3234`

_Note the id must always come first for each encoded list query_

List parameters may be provide without the `param=` prefix e.g. `14354|genre:action`

Only the following options can be present.
  - `order`
  - `order_by`
  - `max_rating`
  - `page_size`
  - `item_type`
  - `param`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of items returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

200.description: The array of item lists requested.

get.description: Returns a list of items under the specified item list

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the list to load.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to load. Starts from page 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of items returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

parameters.name: param
parameters.description: The list parameter in format 'key:value', e.g. 'genre:action'.

get.description:
Returns a page with the specified id.

If targeting the search page you must url encode the search term as a parameter
using the `q` key. For example if your browser path looks like `/search?q=the`
then what you pass to this endpoint would look like `/page?path=/search%3Fq%3Dthe`.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the page to load, e.g. '/movies'.

parameters.name: list_page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to load when prefetching and paging each list in the page row.

parameters.name: list_page_size_large
parameters.description:
The number of items to load when prefetching a continuous scroll list entry in a page.

By default any list page entry with template pattern `/^CS\d+$/` will
be considered a continuous scroll list.

parameters.name: max_list_prefetch
parameters.description: The maximum number of lists to prefetch in the page.

parameters.name: item_detail_expand
parameters.description:
Only relevant when loading item detail pages as these embed a detailed item in the main page entry.

If no value is specified no item dependencies are expanded.

If 'children' is specified then the list of any direct children will be expanded. For example
seasons of a show or episodes of a season.

If 'all' is specified then the parent chain will be expanded along with any child list at each level.
For example if an episode is specified then its season will be expanded and that season's episode list.
The season will have its show expanded and the show will have its season list expanded.

The 'all' options is useful when you deep link into a show/season/episode for the first time as
it provides full context for navigating around the show page. Subsequent navigation around
children of the show should only need to request expand of children.

If 'ancestors' is specified then only the parent chain is included

If an expand is specified which is not relevant to the item type, it will be ignored.

parameters.name: item_detail_select_season
parameters.description:
Only relevant when loading show detail pages as these embed a detailed item in the main page entry.

Since the introduction of the D1,2,3 templates this parameter is now somewhat redundant, or less
likely to have any effect. While it may still be useful in some cases, most of the time the season
selection will be dictated by the configuration of the rows scheduled on the show detail page.
This parameter will only take effect if there are rows used to schedule episodes of a season, like
D1,2,3, or if no rows have a value set for their `seasonOrder` custom field.

Given a targeted show page, it can be useful to get the details of a child season. This option
provides a means to return the `first` or `latest` season of a show embedded in the page.

The `expand` parameter also works here so for example you could land on a show page and request the
`item_detail_select_season=latest` along with `item_detail_expand=all`. This would then return the
detail of the latest season with its list of child episode summaries, and also expand
the detail of the show with its list of seasons summaries.

parameters.name: text_entry_format
parameters.description:
Only relevant to page entries of type `TextEntry`.

Converts the value of a text page entry to the specified format.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of items returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

301.description:
Returned if feature flag `cd` is set and item detail is requested of an item that has
Custom Destination set to an External URL. The `Location` response header contains the URL.

get.description: Returns the details of a Plan with the specified id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the Plan to load.

post.description:
Register a new user, creating them an account.

Registration, when successful, will return an array of access tokens so the user is
immediately signed in.

It returns Catalog and Commerce scoped tokens for both Account and Profile.
The Commerce ones are intended to allow the purchase of a subscription plan
in the step after registration, without the user being prompted to enter
their username and password again.

An email will also be sent with a link they need to click to confirm their
email address. This confirmation is done via the /verify-email endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Registration details.

post.description:
Request the password of an account's primary profile be reset.

Should be called when a user has forgotten their password.

This will send an email with a password reset link to the email address of the
primary profile of an account.

The link, once clicked, should take the user to the "reset-password" page of the
website. Here they will enter their new password and submit to the /reset-password
endpoint here, along with the password reset token provided in the original link.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Email address of account to request a password reset on.

post.description:
When a user requests to reset their password via the /request-password-reset endpoint, an
email is sent to the email address of the primary profile of the account. This email contains a link
with a token as query parameter. The link should takes the user to the "reset-password"
page of the website.

From the reset-password page a user should enter their primary account email address
and the new password they wish to use. These should then be submitted to this endpoint,
along with the token from the email link. The token should be provided in the authorization
header as a bearer token.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Account email and new password.

get.description:
Returns schedules for a defined set of channels over a requested period.

Schedules are requested in hour blocks and returned grouped by the channel
they belong to.

For example, to load 12 hours of schedules for channels `4343` and `5234`,
on 21/2/2017 starting from 08:00.

```
channels=4343,5234
date=2017-02-21
hour=8
duration=12
```

Please remember that `date` and `hour` combined represent a normal datetime, 
so they should be converted to UTC on the client - this will help to avoid 
issues with EPG schedules near midnight.

If a channel id is passed which doesn't exist then this endpoint will
return an empty schedule list for it. If instead we returned 404,
this would invalidate all other channel schedules in the same request
which would be unfriendly for clients presenting these channel schedules.

parameters.name: channels
parameters.description: The list of channel ids to get schedules for.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date to target in ISO format, e.g. `2017-05-23` (converted to UTC - see main description).

The base hour requested will belong to this date.

parameters.name: hour
parameters.description:
The base hour in the day, defined by the `date` parameter, you wish to load schedules for 
(converted to UTC - see main description).

From 0 to 23, where 0 is midnight.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description:
The number of hours of schedules to load from the base `hour` parameter.

This may be negative or positive depending on whether you want to load past or future schedules.

Minimum value is -24, maximum is 24. A value of zero is invalid.

parameters.name: intersect
parameters.description:
Flag indicating whether schedules should intersect or be contained in the
provided interval.

If set to `true`, the result will contain all schedules where either
schedule start time or end time touches the provided interval.

If set to `false`, only schedules fully contained in the given period
will be returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The number of schedule items Rocket's schedules endpoint should return.

Parameter applies (if provided) in conjunction with `duration` parameter with logical `AND`

If more than one channel schedule is requested, then the `limit` parameter applies to each schedule independently on the others.

The `limit` will apply only after the first hour of schedules returned. Thats mean that for next parameters combination: duration=1 limit=1, limit parameter will be ignored.

200.description:
An array of schedule lists for each channel requested.

The order of the channels will match the order of channel ids passed during the request.

get.description: Returns the details of an item schedule with the specified id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the item schedule to load.

get.description: Search the catalog of items and people.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: The search term to query.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
By default people (credits only), movies, tv (shows + programs) will be included in the search results.

If the `cas` feature flag is set, "other" items (`customAsset`s, stage) will
also be included by default

If the `sv2` feature flag is set, events, competitions, teams, confederations and newsHighlights will be included in the search results
Also, when `sv2` feature flag is set, search results include persons (credits and personas) by default instead of people (credits only).

If you don't want all of these types you can specifiy the specific
includes you care about.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description:
When this option is set, instead of all search result items being returned
in a single list, they will instead be returned under two lists. One for
movies and another for tv (shows + programs).

if the `cas` feature flag is set, a third `other` list will be
included containing `customAsset` and `sport`s (stage) results

if the `sv2` feature flag is set, a new lists (events, competitions, teams, confederations and newsHighlights)
will be included in search results

Default is undefined meaning items will be returned in a single list.

The array of `people` (credits only) results is separate from items.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: max_rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of items returned, e.g. 'auoflc-pg'.

post.description:
When an account is created an email is sent to the email address of the new account.
This contains a link, which once clicked, verifies the email address of the account is correct.

The link contains a token as a query parameter which should be passed as the authorization
bearer token to this endpoint to complete email verification.

The token has en expiry, so if the link is not clicked before it expires, the account holder
may need to request a new verification email be sent. This can be done via the endpoint
/account/request-email-verification.

value.description: The token value used for authenticated requests.

refreshable.description: True if this token can be refreshed, false if not.

accountCreated.description:
When a `UserAccount` token is issued during a single-sign-on flow
a user may have been automatically registered if they didn't
have an account already. If this occurs then `accountCreated`
will be `true`.

address.description: The address details of the account holder.

email.description: The email address belonging to the account.

emailVerified.description:
Whether the email address has been verified.

Users who receive an emailed verification url click the link to verify their email address.

firstName.description: The first name of the account holder.

lastName.description: The last name of the account holder.

trackingEnabled.description: Whether usage tracking is associated with the account or anonymous.

pinEnabled.description: When an account level pin is defined this will be true.

marketingEnabled.description: Whether the account has opted in or out of marketing material.

primaryProfileId.description: The id of the primary profile.

usedFreeTrial.description: Whether the account has used up their free trial period of a plan.

minRatingPlaybackGuard.description:
The classification rating defining the minimum rating level a user should be
forced to enter the account pin code for playback. Anything at this rating
level or above will require the pin for playback.

e.g. AUOFLC-MA15+

If you want to disable this guard pass an empty string or `null`.

defaultPaymentMethodId.description: The id of the payment method to use by default for account transactions.

defaultPaymentInstrumentId.description:
The id of the payment instrument to use by default for account transactions.

 **DEPRECATED** The property `defaultPaymentMethodId` is now preferred.

subscriptions.description: The list of subscriptions, if any, the account has signed up to.

subscriptionCode.description:
The active subscription code for an account.

The value of this should be passed to any endpoints accepting a `sub` query parameter.

profiles.description: The list of profiles under this account.

entitlements.description: The list of entitlements to playback specific items.

segments.description: The segments an account has been placed under

devices.description: The array of registered playack devices.

maxRegistered.description:
The maximum number of playback devices that can be registered
under an account at a single time.

If there is no maximum defined this value will be `-1`.

registrationWindow.description:
Defines the start and end date of the current registration window along with calculated limits.

If undefined then there are no registration limits for a period.

For example given a registration period of 30 days, this sliding window will start on the
oldest registration of the last 30 days, and end 30 days from that registration date.

In this window there is a limit on how many devices can be registered in 30 days.
If exceeded then no more devices can be registered unless one is deregistered or the
oldest registration drops off the 30 day window.

Deregistration also has potential limits which may prevent a device being deregistered.
In this case the user must wait until the oldest deregistered device is more than 30
days old.

deregistrationWindow.description:
Defines the start and end date of the current deregistration window along with calculated limits.

If undefined then there are no deregistration limits for a period.

For example given a deregistration period of 30 days, this sliding window will start on the
oldest deregistration of the last 30 days, and end 30 days from that deregistration date.

In this window there is a limit on how many devices can be deregistered in 30 days.
If exceeded then no more devices can be deregistered unless the oldest deregistration drops
off the 30 day window.

id.description: The unique identifier for the device e.g. serial number.

email.description: The email associated with the account.

password.description:
The password associated with the account.

Either a pin or password should be supplied. If both are supplied the password will take precedence.

pin.description:
The pin associated with the account.

Either a pin or password should be supplied. If both are supplied the password will take precedence.

scopes.description:
The scope(s) of the tokens required.
For each scope listed an Account and Profile token of that scope will be returned

cookieType.description:
If you specify a cookie type then a content filter cookie will be returned
along with the token(s). This is only intended for web based clients which
need to pass the cookies to a server to render a page based on the user's
content filters e.g subscription code.

If type `Session` the cookie will be session based.
If type `Persistent` the cookie will have a medium term lifespan.
If undefined no cookies will be set.

address.description:
The address of the account holder.

If the address is provided any properties which are omitted from the address will be cleared.

firstName.description: The first name of the account holder.

lastName.description: The last name of the account holder.

trackingEnabled.description: Whether usage tracking is associated with an account or anonymous.

defaultPaymentMethodId.description: The id of the payment method to use by default for account transactions.

defaultPaymentInstrumentId.description:
The id of the payment instrument to use by default for account transactions.

**DEPRECATED** The property `defaultPaymentMethodId` is now preferred.

minRatingPlaybackGuard.description:
The classification rating defining the minimum rating level a user should be
forced to enter the account pin code for playback. Anything at this rating
level or above will require the pin for playback.

e.g. AUOFLC-MA15+

If you want to disable this guard pass an empty string or `null`.

segments.description: The segments an account should be placed under

token.description:
The payment provider token representing a payment method, obtained by
submitting payment method details to your third party provider.

makeDefault.description:
Whether this payment method should become the account default when 
making purchases.

Note that if this is the first payment method of type Card being added to an
account then it will become the default whether this property is true or false.

addressLine1.description: The first line of the street address.

addressLine2.description: The second line of the street address.

themes.description: An array of globally configured themes.

websiteUrl.description: The url of the primary website.

gaToken.description: A Google Analytics token to track applicaton user events.

stripeKey.description: The public Stripe key to use for payment transactions.

facebookAppId.description: The Facebook application id associated with an environment.

itemImageTypes.description: A map of default item image types where the key is the item types.

customFields.description: A map of custom configuration fields.

maxUserRating.description: The maximum value allowed for user ratings.

mandatorySignIn.description: Whether to require sign in for customers to access content.

defaultTimeZone.description: The default time zone of the site. e.g. "Etc/GMT"

viewingWindowDaysAfter.description: Number of available upcoming day schedules.

viewingWindowDaysBefore.description: Number of available day schedules in the past.

scheduleCacheMaxAgeMinutes.description: Maximum time in minutes for which channel schedule information can be used without being refreshed

heartbeatFrequency.description: How often a heartbeat should be renewed during playback.

viewEventPoints.description:
An array of percentage points in which to fire off plabyack view events.
For example a value of 0.5 would indicate that an event should be
fired when the user is half way through the video.
Often known as quartiles when four equaly spread event points.

chainPlaySqueezeback.description:
The number of seconds before the end of playback when the current video
should be minimized and user options are presented within the video player.

If set to 0 there will be no squeezeback.

chainPlayTimeout.description:
The number of minutes of user inactivity before autoplay is paused.

If set to 0 there will be no autoplay timeout.

chainPlayCountdown.description:
The number of seconds before autoplay of next video.

If set to 0 there will be no autoplay.

maxFollowsPerProfile.description: Maximum number of follows a profile can have.

plans.description: The available public plans a user can subscribe to.

itemId.description: The id of the item bookmarked.

creationDate.description: The date the bookmark was created.

password.description: The new password for the account.

level.description:
The level of this classification when compared with its siblings.
A higher level means a greater restriction.
Each classification in a system should have a unique level.

system.description: The parent system code of the classification.

code.description: The unique code for a classification.

name.description: The name of the classification for display.

itemInclusions.description:
Object where keys are itemIds for the items in the list and values are objects
containing additional items (either episode/season/show) that were requested
in the "include" query option.

For example if you request the ContinueWatching list with "season" items in
the list, you can specify `include=episode` and then the specific next episode
will be returned in this object.

role.description: The type of role the credit performed, e.g. actor.

id.description: The unique identifier for this device e.g. serial number.

name.description: The human recognisable name for this device.

registrationDate.description: The date this device was registered.

id.description: The unique identifier for this device e.g. serial number.

name.description: A human recognisable name for this device.

periodDays.description: The number of days a de/registration period runs for.

limit.description: The maximum de/registrations that can be made in a period.

remaining.description: The remaining de/registrations that can be made in the current period.

startDate.description:
The start date of the current period.

This is based on the earliest device de/registrations in the past N days, where
N is defined by `periodDays`.

If no device has been de/registered then start date will be from the current date.

endDate.description:
The end date of the current period.

This is based on the value of `startDate` plus the number of days defined by  `periodDays`.

activationDate.description: The date of activation. If no date is defined the entitlement has not be activated.

creationDate.description: The date the entitlement was created.

playCount.description: How many times the media has been played.

remainingDownloads.description: How many more downloads of this media are available.

itemId.description: The id of the item this entitlement is for.

itemType.description: The type of item this entitlement is for.

planId.description: The id of the plan this entitlement is for.

mediaDuration.description: The duration of the entitled media.

classification.description: The classification of the entitled item.

ExclusionRule.description: Defines playback exclusion rules for an Offer or Entitlement.

device.description: The device type that the exclusion rules apply to.

excludeAirplay.description: Prevent airplay from an apple device.

itemId.description: The id of the item followed.

creationDate.description: The date the followed item was created.

ItemCustomMetadata.description: Custom metadata associated with an item.

name.description: The name of the custom metadata.

value.description: The value of the custom metadata.

advisoryText.description: Advisory text about this item, related to the classification

customMetadata.description:
An ordered list of custom name-value-pair item metadata.
Usually displayed on an item detail page.

genrePaths.description: An array of genre paths mapping to the values within the `genres` array from ItemSummary.

location.description:
The optional location (e.g. city) of an event.
Specific to Program and Event item types.

venue.description:
The optional venue of an event.
Specific to Program and Event item types.

eventDate.description:
The optional date of an event.
Specific to a Program item type.

credits.description: A list of credits associated with this item.

seasons.description: A list of seasons associated with this item.

episodes.description: A list of episodes associated with this item.

season.description: The season associated with this item.

show.description: The season associated with this item.

totalUserRatings.description: The total number of users who have rated this item.

trailers.description: A list of trailers associated with this item.

description.description: A full description of this list.

shortDescription.description: A short description of this list.

itemTypes.description: The types of items in the list

size.description: The total size of the list

parameter.description:
If this list is parameterized, then this contains the parameter of the list in the format `name:value`.
For example the Movies Genre list will take a parameter `genre` with a given value. e.g. `genre:action` or `genre:drama`.

paging.description: Metadata describing how to load the next or previous page of the list

customFields.description: A map of custom fields defined by a curator for a list.

listData.description:
Extra data needed for the specific list. The format and content will change
depending on the list

id.description: The identifier of the purchased item.

ownership.description: The ownership of the purchased item.

resolution.description: The resolution of the purchased item.

title.description: The title of the purchased item.

ItemRelationship.description: Contains related items grouped by relationship type key

channelId.description: The id of the channel item this schedule belongs to.

startDate.description: The date and time this schedule starts.

endDate.description: The date and time this schedule ends.

repeat.description: True if this has been aired previously on the same channel.

live.description: True if this is a live event.

featured.description: True if this is a featured item schedule.

blackout.description: True if this schedule represents time when the channel is completely off air.

ItemScheduleDetailItem.description: The item this schedule targets. This is just an ItemDetail with a few extra fields.

showAverageUserRating.description:
The average user rating of associated show.
When based on user ratings from our system this will be out of 10.
Only valid for episodes.

showTotalUserRatings.description:
The total number of users who have rated this item.
Only valid for episodes.

channelId.description: The id of the channel the schedules belong to.

startDate.description: The date and time this list of schedules starts.

endDate.description: The date and time this list of schedules ends.

subtype.description:
Subtype of the item. Mainly used to identify different types when `type`
is `customAsset`

title.description: The display title of the item.

contextualTitle.description:
A contextually relative title to display after a parent title.
Mostly applicable to Season, Episode and Trailer.

shortDescription.description: A truncated description of the item

classification.description: The classification rating of this item.

path.description: The path to the detail page of this item. Can be used to load the item detail page via the /page endpoint.

watchPath.description: The path to watch this item, if the item is a watchable type, e.g. a `movie`, `program` and `episode`.

releaseYear.description: The year this item was released

episodeCount.description: The number of episodes in the season, if the item is a season.

availableEpisodeCount.description: The number of available episodes in the season, if the item is a season.

availableSeasonCount.description: The number of available seasons in the show, if the item is a show.

seasonNumber.description: The number of a season, if the item is a season.

episodeNumber.description: The number of an episode, if the item is an episode.

episodeName.description: The full name of an episode.

showId.description: The identifier of the show this item belongs to, if the item is a season or episode.

showTitle.descritpion: The title of the show this item belongs to, if the item is a season or episode.

seasonId.description: The identifier of the season this item belongs to, if the item is an episode.

channelShortCode.description: The channel short code, if the item is a channel.

averageUserRating.description:
The average user rating.
When based on user ratings from our system this will be out of 10.

genres.description: The array of genres this item belongs to.

sports.description: The array of sports this item belongs to.

duration.description: The duration of the media in seconds.

customId.description:
A custom identifier for this item.
For example the id for this item under a different content system.

eventStartDate.description:
The optional event start date.
Specific to Event item type.

eventEndDate.description:
The optional event end date.
Specific to Event item type.

round.description:
The optional event round.
Specific to Event item type.

sequenceNumber.description:
The optional sequence number for event or stage.
Specific to Event and Stage item types.

yearStart.description:
The optional competition start year
Specific to Competition item type

yearEnd.description:
The optional competition end year
Specific to Competition item type

role.description:
The optional role.
Specific to Persona, Team item types

offers.description: The array of available offers for this item.

themes.description: Gets themes associated with the item

customFields.description: A map of custom fields defined by a curator for an item.

relationships.description: The related items with this item

code.description:
The ISO language code of the language e.g. "en-US".
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes

ListData.description:
Extra data to accompany ItemList content. The (single) key in the object is
the list name and the data changes depending on the list

name.description: The name of the media file.

deliveryType.description: The way in which the media file is delivered.

url.description: The url to access the media file.

drm.description: The type of drm used to encrypt the media. 'None' if unencrypted.

format.description: The format the media was encoded in.

resolution.description: The resolution of the video media.

width.description: The width of the video media.

height.description: The height of the video media.

language.description: The language code for the media, e.g. 'en'.

title.description: The title of the embedded navigation content.

imageType.description:
The image type to target when rendering items of the list.

e.g wallpaper, poster, hero3x1, logo.

depth.description: The depth of the NavEntry (top level is 0)

label.description: The text label for this nav entry.

icon.description: The identifier of the icon to be displayed.

path.description:
The path this nav entry links to.
May be undefined if the nav entry is not clickable e.g. a nav heading.
If the value begins with `http` then it's an external url.

content.description: Embedded content to display in a navigation menu.

featured.description:
True if this is a featured menu item.

Featured menu items may have a more prominent presentation than others in the navigation.

customFields.description: A map of custom fields defined by a curator for a nav entry.
A map of custom fields defined by a curator for navigation.

sourceItemId.description: The id of the item used to determine the next item to play.

firstWatchedDate.description:
Time when the item corresponding to the itemId passed in by the client was
first watched by the user. Will be `undefined` if the user has never
watched the item.

It can be used to identify the scenario where the user has never watched a
show and we are suggesting they watch the first episode (i.e. it is
missing in this scenario)

**This will only be populated when a `showId` is passed in**

lastWatchedDate.description:
Time when the item corresponding to the itemId passed in by the client was
last watched by the user. Will be `undefined` if the user has never
watched the item.

It can be used to identify the scenario where the user has never watched a
show and we are suggesting they watch the first episode (i.e. it is
missing in this scenario)

**This will only be populated when a `showId` is passed in**

suggestionType.description:
Field indicating the type or reason behind the suggestion.

Id Type   | Show Watched Status| Value            | Description
----------|--------------------|------------------|---------------------------------
showId    | Unwatched          | StartWatching    |
showId    | Completely watched | RestartWatching  |
showId    | Partly watched     | ContinueWatching | Suggested episode partly watched
showId    | Partly watched     | Sequential       | Suggested episode unwatched
episodeId | Any                | Sequential       | Next episode in show

next.description:
The details of the next item to play.

If `undefined` then no item was found.

subscriptionCode.description: The code of the subscription this offer is offered under, if any.

customFields.description: A map of custom fields defined by a curator for an offer.

OfferRights.description: The base type for both Offer and Entitlement.

maxPlays.description: The maximum number of allowed plays.

maxDownloads.description: The maximum number of allowed downloads.

rentalPeriod.description: The length of time in minutes which the rental will last once purchased.

playPeriod.description: The length of time in minutes which the rental will last once played for the first time.

customFields.description: A map of custom fields defined by a curator for a page.

item.description:
When the page represents the detail of an item this property will contain the item detail.

For clients consuming an item detail page, any page row entry of type `ItemDetailEntry`
should look to obtain its data from the contents of this property.

*Note that you have to be using feature flag `idp` to enable this
on item detail pages. See `feature-flags.md` for further details.*

list.description:
When the page represents the detail of a List this property will contain the list in question.

For clients consuming a list detail page, any page row entry of type `ListDetailEntry`
should look to obtain its data from the contents of this property.

*Note that you have to be using feature flag `ldp` to enable this
on list detail pages. See `feature-flags.md` for further details.*

PageEntry.description:
Represents an entry of a Page.
Defines what specific piece of content should be presented e.g. an Item or ItemList.
Also defines what visual template should be used to render that content.

id.description: The unique identifier for a page entry.

type.description: The type of PageEntry. Used to help identify what type of content will be presented.

title.description: The name of the Page Entry.

template.description: Template type used to present the content of the PageEntry.

item.description: If 'type' is 'ItemEntry' then this is the item to be represented.

list.description: If 'type' is 'ListEntry' or 'UserEntry' then this is the list to be represented.

text.description: If 'type' is 'TextEntry' then this is the text to be represented.

people.description: If 'type' is 'PeopleEntry' then this is the array of people to present.

customFields.description: A map of custom fields defined by a curator for a page entry.

images.description:
The images for the page entry if any.

For example the images of an `ImageEntry`.

PageMetadata.description: Metadata associated with a page. Primarily intended for SEO usage.

key.description: Key used to lookup a known page.

template.description: Identifier for of the page template to render this page.

isStatic.description:
True if this page is static and doesn't have any dynamic content to load.

Static pages don't need to go back to the page endpoint to load page content
instead the page summary loaded with the sitemap should be enough to determine
the page template type and render based on this.

isSystemPage.description:
True if this page is a system page type.

**DEPRECATED** This property doesn't have any real use in client applications
anymore so shouldn't be used. It especially shouldn't be used to determine if
a page is static or not. Use the `isStatic` property instead.

next.description: Path to load next page of data, or null if not available

previous.description: Path to load previous page of data, or null if not available.

page.description:
The current page number.

A value of 0 indicates that the fist page has not yet been loaded. This is
useful when wanting to return the paging metadata to indicate how to
load in the first page.

size.description:
The current page size.

A value of -1 indicates that the size has not yet been determined. This may
arise when embedding secure list pagination info in a page which must be cached
by a CDN. For example a Bookmarks list.

total.description:
The total number of pages available given the current page size.

A value of -1 indicates that the total has not yet been determined. This may
arise when embedding secure list pagination info in a page which must be cached
by a CDN. For example a Bookmarks list.

authorization.description:
The authorization requirements to load a page of items.

This will only be present on lists which are protected by some form
of authorization token e.g. Bookmarks, Watched, Entitlements.

options.description:
Any active list sort and filter options.

If an option has a default value then it won't be defined.

type.description: The token type required to load the list.

pageSize.description: The number of items to return in a list page.

order.description: The applied sort order if any.

orderBy.description: The applied sort ordering property if any.

maxRating.description: The maximum rating (inclusive) of items returned, e.g. 'AUOFLC-PG'.

completed.description:
Items filtered by whether they've been fully watched or not.

Only available on the `/account/profile/watched/list` endpoint currently.

email.description: The email address of the primary account profile to reset the password for.
The email address of the primary account profile to reset the password for.

password.description: The new password for the primary account profile.

id.description: The unique identifier of a payment method.

description.description:
A short description of a payment method.

If the payment method is of type `Wallet` this will be "My Wallet"

For `Card` type payment methods the format of this description may differ
depending on the payment gateway in use. In the case of Stripe, this will
be in the format "Visa (**** 4242, exp 08/19)"

brand.description: The brand of the card if the payment method is a card.

balance.description: The balance of the wallet if the payment method is a wallet.

currency.description: The currency code of the wallet if the payment method is a wallet.

expiryMonth.description: The expiry month of the card if the payment method is a card.

expiryYear.description: The expiry year of the card if the payment method is a card.

lastDigits.description:
The last digits of the card if the payment method is a card.
Depending on the payment gateway in use this value may be undefined.

tagline.description: The short tagline for a plan.

isFeatured.description: True if a plan should be highlighted as featured, false if not.

isActive.description: True if a plan is active, false if its retired.

isPrivate.description: True if a plan should not be presented in the primary plan options, false if not.

revenueType.description: The revenue type a plan targets.

subscriptionCode.description: The subscription code a plan targets.

benefits.description: The list of benefits to display for a plan.

billingPeriodType.description: The type of billing period used.

billingPeriodFrequency.description: Given the `billingPeriodType` this is how frequently it will run. e.g. every 2 weeks.

hasTrialPeriod.description: True if a plan has a trial period, false if not.

trialPeriodDays.description: How many days a trial period runs for a plan. Only valid if `hasTrialPeriod` is true.

termsAndConditions.description: The terms and conditions for a plan.

price.description: The price of a plan. If a free plan then undefined.

currency.description: The currency a plan is offered in.

customFields.description: A map of custom fields defined by a curator for a plan.

id.description: The identifier of the purchased plan.

price.description: The price of the purchased plan.

subscriptionId.description: The identifier of the subscription membership to the plan.

title.description: The title of the purchased plan.

name.description: The unique name of the profile.

pinEnabled.description:
Whether an account pin is required to enter the profile.

If no account pin is defined this has no impact.

purchaseEnabled.description: Whether the profile can make purchases with the account payment options.

segments.description: The segments a profile should be placed under

languageCode.description:
The code of the preferred language for the profile.
Must be a valid ISO language code e.g. "en-US" and must match the code of
one of the languages specified in the app config.
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes

watched.description: A map of watched itemIds => last watched position

rated.description: A map of rated itemIds => rating out of 10

bookmarked.description: A map of bookmarked itemIds => created date

followed.description: A map of followed itemIds => created date

name.description: The unique name of the profile.

pinEnabled.description: Whether a pin is required to enter the profile.

purchaseEnabled.description: Whether the profile can make purchases with the account payment options.

color.description: Hex color value assigned to the profile.

segments.description: The segments a profile has been placed under

isActive.x-deprecated: Inactive profiles are no longer returned
isActive.description:
Whether the profile is active or not.

**DEPRECATED** - Always true. Inactive profiles are no longer returned.

marketingEnabled.description:
Whether the profile has opted in or out of marketing material.

**DEPRECATED** - Marketing material is no longer tied to profiles, only account. See `Account.marketingEnabled`.

maxRatingContentFilter.description:
The maximum rating (inclusive) of content to return in feeds.

**DEPRECATED** - It's no longer recommended filtering content globally as apps can end up
with pages without content, even the homepage. Instead using features like segmentation
tags to target demographics like kids means content curation can be more thought out.

minRatingPlaybackGuard.description:
The minumum rating (inclusive) of content where an account pin should be presented before entring playback.

**DEPRECATED** - The playback guard is now defined at the account level, where an account
pin also exists. This is then applied across all profiles.

languageCode.description:
The code of the preferred language for the profile.
Must be a valid ISO language code e.g. "en-US" and must match the code of
one of the languages specified in the app config.
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes

profileId.description: The id of the profile the token should grant access rights to.

pin.description: The pin associated with this profile, if any.

scopes.description: The scope(s) of the token(s) required.

cookieType.description:
If you specify a cookie type then a content filter cookie will be returned
along with the token(s). This is only intended for web based clients which
need to pass the cookies to a server to render a page based on the user's
content filters e.g subscription code.

If type `Session` the cookie will be session based.
If type `Persistent` the cookie will have a medium term lifespan.
If undefined no cookies will be set.

name.description: The unique name of the profile.

pinEnabled.description:
Whether an account pin is required to enter the profile.

If no account pin is defined this has no impact.

purchaseEnabled.description: Whether the profile can make purchases with the account payment options.

segments.description: The segments a profile should be placed under

languageCode.description:
The code of the preferred language for the profile.
Must be a valid ISO language code e.g. "en-US" and must match the code of
one of the languages specified in the app config.
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes

authorizationDate.description: The date the purchase was authorized.

creationDate.description: The date the purchase was created.

currency.description: The currency code used to make the purchase.

item.description: The purchased item. Not applicable if the purchase was made for a plan.

paymentMethodId.description: The identifier of the payment method used to make the purchase.

plan.description: The purchased plan. Not applicable if the purchase was made for items.

total.description: The total cost of the purchase.

itemId.description:
The identifier of the item to purchase.
Both `itemId` and `offerId` are required for item purchases.

offerId.description:
The identifier of the item offer to purchase.
Both `itemId` and `offerId` are required for item purchases.

planId.description: The identifier of the plan to purchase.

paymentMethodId.description:
The identifier of the payment method to use.
Can be omitted, or if purchasing a plan, the default payment method will be used (but default payment method should be setup before).
If default payment method was not setup, payment method must be provided.

marketing.description: Whether to receive marketing material or not. Default to true.

segments.description: The segments to apply to the primary profile.

languageCode.description:
The code of the preferred language for the primary profile.
Must be a valid ISO language code e.g. "en-US" and must match the code of
one of the languages specified in the app config.
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes

items.description:
The list of all items relevant to the search term.

If this is present then the `movies` and `tv` lists won't be.

movies.description:
The list of movie items relevant to the search term.

If this is present then the `items` list won't be.

tv.description:
The list of tv items (shows + programs) relevant to the search term.

If this is present then the `items` list won't be.

other.description:
The list of other items (`customAsset`s) relevant to the search term.

If this is present then the `items` list won't be.

people.description: The list of people (credits only) relevant to the search term.

persons.description:
The list of persons relevant to the search term.

The list is returned only when `sv2` feature flag is set and it
contains `Persona` and `Credit` item types.

events.description:
The list of events relevant to search term.

If this is present then the `items` list won't be.

competitions.description:
The list of competitions relevant to search term.

If this is present then the `items` list won't be.

teams.description:
The list of teams relevant to search term.

If this is present then the `items` list won't be.

confederations.description:
The list of confederations relevant to search term.

If this is present then the `items` list won't be.

newsHighlights.description:
The list of news and highlights relevant to search term.
This list may include different asset types, and will build based on asset subtype value

If this is present then the `items` list won't be.

code.description: An optional code classifying the error. Should be taken in the context of the http status code.

token.description: A token from the third party single-sign-on provider e.g. an identity token from Facebook.

scopes.description:
The scope(s) of the tokens required.
For each scope listed an Account and Profile token of that scope will be returned.

cookieType.description:
If you specify a cookie type then a content filter cookie will be returned
along with the token(s). This is only intended for web based clients which
need to pass the cookies to a server to render a page based on the user's
content filters e.g subscription code.

If type `Session` the cookie will be session based.
